messages.subject: Northeast Unschooling Camping Relocated
messages.msgSnippet: Due positive tests for West Nile at Heckscher State Park the campground is currently closed with no guarantee they will open for our scheduled camping trip.
messages.messageBody:
Due positive tests for West Nile at Heckscher State Park the
campground is currently closed with no guarantee they will open for
our scheduled camping trip.

Unschooling Camping trip is now at Allaire State Park in Monmouth
County, NJ.

732 938 2371

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/allaire.html

Information as follows:

Unschooling Gathering - Camping on Jersey Shore

Spread the word

Several unschooling families will be camping at Allaire State Park's
camp ground in Monmouth County, NJ, from August 26th through
September 5th this summer and would welcome other unschoolers
joining the group for all or part of that time. There are still many
sites available. We've done this in past years and it's always nice
to have other families coming and going throughout the week.

The park is 15 minutes to Jersey Shore beaches (Blemar and Spring
Lake). Half hour to Island Beach State Park. 20 minutes to Point
Pleasant. 3 miles from small grocery store and 6 miles to all major
shopping amenities, restaurants and entertainment, etc. 10 minutes
to County Park with canoe and Kayak rental for reservoir boating.

In the past, while camping with multiple families, we've kept it
pretty flexible and loose not doing too much planning so that
families and individuals can follow their own needs while providing
a great group experience. This camping trip is organized in such a
fashion that being together doesn't mean anyone is obligated to
follow anyone else's agenda or schedule, however, there is always a
lot of overlap, shared meals, shared bike trips, beach trips, etc.
If we're a large group, we try not to complicate the trip by
expecting or planning an entire group to do the same thing each day
throughout the week - but hey - sometimes even that happens!

The state park itself offers:

Visitor Center/Museum

Manasquan River for canoeing and fishing

5 mile paved bike trail from park to Manasquan (ocean beach town)

Nature Interpretive Center

Dirt trails throughout the park for hikers, mountain bikes and
horseback riders

19th Century Historic Allaire Village - tours and activities
http://www.allairevillage.org/

Pine Creek Railroad (antique steam trains)

Playgrounds

Birdwatching

Check out the website:
http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/allaire.html

Campground for tent sites or RV (no electric or water hookup)

Fees $20 per night for 2 tents, 6 people, 2 cars per site.

Also has Yurts and Shelters (see link for descriptions) - though
none are available on the weekend at this time. There is a
playground right in the campground. Hot showers as well.

To book campsite call (732) 938 2371. There are still sites
available.

Try to be next too or near site #41 - but nothing is that far away.

If you want more information or details contact me directly. Please
spread the word and post this on other unschooling lists.

Lisa Heyman

Lmanathome@...
